result.execSummary:
The defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay a fine of $20.00 plus mandatory costs, assessment and surcharges by 11-23-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and other collection can proceed.

Huber privileges for work, commencing on 09-25-15 by 2pm

- Court advised the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substances or alcohol forfeits the release privileges.
Court advised the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order received and filed.  COURT ORDERS defendant to pay monetary amounts ordered at sentencing by 11-23-15 or a civil judgement is to be entered against the defendant and other collection can proceed.  Copies mailed to the defendant, Attorney Ertl and ADA Wittchow./ds

Defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.    Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction commencing by 2:00 p.m. on 9-25-15 with Huber privileges for work and 3 days credit; pay a fine of $20 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  The Court takes judicial notice of judgment of conviction for case 06CF3742 attached to criminal complaint.  Court advises the parties to submit any written statements 72 hours in advance of the hearing.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Dennis Murphy for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has discovery and an offer. Defense requested a projected guilty plea and sentencing date. Court reminded the defendant to bring any materials relevant to sentencing at the next court date. Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Case adjourned. Plea and sentencing hearing scheduled for 09/10/2015 at 8:30am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has just been appointed.  Defense still waiting for additional discovery.  State to provide.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/21/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant does qualify for a public defender.  Case adjourned for status of counsel on 7/9/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Toran informs the court that he needs to withdraw, and that the defendant would qualify for representation from the public defender's office.  Court allow attorney Toran to withdraw, and sends defendant to Public Defender's office to see if he will qualify, and get an attorney appointed.  Case passed to 1:30 pm.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/30/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw

Defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Kalvinmehran Allanlassa Paige in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
